title: Phillis Wheatley
summary: Phillis Wheatley Peters, also spelled Phyllis and Wheatly (c. 1753 â€“ December 5, 1784) was the first African-American author of a published book of poetry.[2][3] Born in West Africa, she was sold into slavery at the age of seven or eight and transported to North America, where she was bought by the Wheatley family of Boston. After she learned to read and write, they encouraged her poetry when they saw her talent.
